channel.description: America's Talk Show for Baby Boomers. It can be heard weekly as an educational program. Hosted by Daniel Davis, he interviews many guests who are innovative, solution-oriented, and pragmatic visionaries. The talks are designed to help with your many life transitions to live it with great passion, heart-wisdom and intelligence. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

item.title: EPISODE 380 - ASEA: Redox Signaling Molecules for Optimal Cellular Health
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Trish Schwenkler, a top earning distributor for ASEA. She will talk about ASEA's Redox Signaling Molecules that are foundational to cellular health and proper function. Redox Signaling Molecules are naturally found within cells to support cellular communication; protect against free radical damage; boost efficiency of the body's own antioxidants by up to 500%; help to make the action of some nutrients and blood messengers (such as hormones and insulin more efficient); and other benefits. The ASEA product is a perfectly balanced mixture of Redox Signaling reactive molecules that exists outside of the body as a supplement to support it on a cellular level. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 379 - Qigong Sensory Massage for Autism
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Pam Tindall. Currently, there are 1 in 88 children who are born with Autism. Learn from Pam about a cutting-edge, proven treatment for Autism called Qigong Sensory Training that parents can do on their child that is based on the ancient methods of chinese Tui Na Massage and Qigong to move the Qi (Life Force energies) and Blood that's often blocked from the neck up. After several months of massage to their autistic child, parents are reporting fewer tantrums and less aggression; sleep better; acquire language and social skills; open up to the world around them; and can catch up on their developmental milestones. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 378 - The Eskimo & The Oil Man
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Political" talks, listen to an interview with Bob Reiss. He has traveled to the Arctic 7 times to determine just how vulnerable the United States is in the race for resources and security in the Arctic. This summer Shell Oil company plans to sink exploratory wells in the pristine waters off the North Slope of Alaska - a field that the company believes may contain three times as much oil as has been taken from the Gulf of Mexico since 1990, possibly 27 billion barrels. Is it oil, other resources, shipping rights and shortcuts or national security? All question American superiority in the region. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 376 - We Heard the Heavens Then
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Cultural Diversity" talks, listen to an interview with Aria Minu-Sepehr. He will discuss about his childhood to adult memories of growing up in Iran. You'll learn about his rare access to the political poles of his Iranian society before the revolution; how daily life drastically changed when the Iranian monarchy collapsed and was replaced by the Islamic Republic; his life now, after three decades of persecution by the Islamic Republic; and Minu-Sepehr's perspective on the current events in Iran and the Middle East. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 375 - Dr. Joe Dispenza: Breaking the Habit of Being Yourself
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Joe Dispenza. He'll explain about how to lose your mind and create a new one. You are not doomed by your genes and hardwired to be a certain way for the rest of your life. A new science is emerging that empowers all human beings to create the reality they choose. Dr. Dispenza combines the fields of quantum physics, neuroscience, brain chemistry, biology and genetics to show you what is truly possible. You can rewire your mental and emotional circuitry in order to step into your own destiny. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 374 - Slinging Mud: Two Centuries of Dirty Politics
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "History" talks, listen to an interview with Rosemarie Ostler. She'll talk about mudslinging that's an American tradition as old as the republic. Not everyone admired the Father of Our Country. President Washington's enemies called him a chapskate, a hyena, a horse beater, a spoiled child, and a tyrannical monster, among other epithets. Every era has its share of politically motivated insults. You'll learn about memorable words and expressions from two centuries worth of going negative. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 373 - The Synthesis Effect: Your Direct Path to Personal Power
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. John McGrail. His passion is helping people overcome their debilitating fears, limiting beliefs and other issues that prevent them from living to their fullest potential. The McGrail Method of Quantum Synthesis can help to activate and exploit the elasticity and creative potential of your mind - re-program the mental computer - using self-hypnosis and several forms of meditation, while concurrently integrating an array of simple, yet powerful cognitive techniques that catalyze, reinforce and accelerate the entire process. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 372 - The Open Focus Brain: Breaking the Addiction to Narrow Focus
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Les Fehmi. He'll explain that many of us have become stuck in "narrow-focus attention": a tense, survival mode of attention that holds us in a state of chronic stress - and which lies at the root of common ailments including anxiety, depress, ADD, stress-related migraines and more. To improve these conditions, we must learn to return to a relaxed, diffuse, and creative form of attention he called "Open Focus." Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Celebrity" talks, listen to an interview with Pam Grier. She became famous in the early 1970s, after starring in a string of moderately successful women in prison and blaxploitation films such as 1974's "Foxy Brown." She'll talk about her career and serving as a spokesperson for Dining Out for Life, an international fundraiser for HIV/AIDS service organizations. item.title: EPISODE 367 - The Thirteenth Step: One Man's Odyssey of Recovery
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Robert Hayward. He was an incurable alcoholic and drug addict. At 45, he was dying and his wife was leaving him. He learned later in life that he was Native American. He bought a tipi and a ceremony of healing came with it. That was 12 years ago. And, he has been sober since. Robert talks for the first time allowed about the ritual of the tipi ceremony for the purpose of healing. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 364 - The Age of Platform
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Business" talks, listen to interview with Phil Simon. He'll share six things your business can learn from the Gang of Four, such as collaborating with your customers, like Amazon does, and turn a bigger profit; expand your product lines and service offerings like Google; invite innovation from outside your company, like Apple, and profit from risk; and prepare for uncertainty, like Facebook, and be ready when unforseen change occurs. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 362 - The Monroe Institute: Exploration of the Human Consciousness
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Carol Sabick de la Herran of The Monroe Institute in Virginia. She will explain about the founder, the late Robert A. Monroe who began investigating methods and techniques of accelerated learning in the late 1950s, then conducted experiential seminars in the exploration of consciousness since the 1970s using audio-guidance technology. Many people of all ages have used it to achieve personal goals by facilitating and sustaining a focused, highly productive, coherent mind-brain state. Through their programs, you can come to the realization that you are more than your physical body. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 361 - Mini-Nuclear Power Plants Can Save the World
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Science" talks, listen to an interview with Reese Palley. In the wake of the disaster at Japan's Fukushima Daiichi plant, he proposes the development and deployment of a fleet of small, inherently save nuclear powre reactors. It's a move away from huge, multi-megawatt plants to much smaller (container-sized) modular plants to produce clean energy at the local level - getting us off the worst of our fossil-fuel gluttony within a decade. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

It's a move away from huge, multi-megawatt plants to much smaller (container-sized) modular plants to produce clean energy at the local level - getting us off the worst of our fossil-fuel gluttony within a decade. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 359 - Date Therapy: Unlock Your Subconscious Mind
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Lydia Belton, fondly known as Dr. Tranquility. According to her, the reason that many people make repeated mistakes in choosing their relationship partners is that they they think they want certain characteristics, values and behaviors on a conscious level, but what they really want is hidden in the deep layers of their subconscious mind. Thus, they are picking partners who are destined to ultimately make them unhappy and are not a good match for who they are. Date therapy is designed to get past that using hypnotherapy to find someone who matches your true values. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 356 - A Universe from Nothing
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Science" talks, listen to an interview with Lawrence Krauss. He will discuss about the current picture of the Universe, how it will end, and how it could have come from nothing. The latest physics research into the origins of the Universe shows that, not only can our universe arise from nothing, but more generally, the laws of quantum mechanics and relativity imply that something will generally always arise from nothing. Even space, and the very laws of physics, may so arise. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Loren Lockman, founder of the Tanglewood Wellness Center in Costa Rica. He is a world authority on fasting and has never been sick for over 24 years. Since 1993, he has been supervising fasts and teaching the principles throughout the U.S., Canada, and Europe. He healed himself using the laws of nature to reverse his Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Candidiasis, Sinusitis and almost 60 allergies. item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Priscilla Warner. She endured forty years of suffering from anxiety and panic attacks. So when she read about Tibetan monks who had meditated so effectively that they were able to change their brains, Warner wanted in. She tried spiritual chanting, meditative painting, restorative yoga, immersion in a Jewish ritual bath, and quasi-hallucinogenic Ayurvedic oil treatments. item.title: EPISODE 347 - Overcoming Adrenal Fatigue
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Kathryn Simpson. She'll explain about how our adrenal glands play a key role in controlling stress and maintaining energy throughout the day. When these small but important glands malfunction, one of the first signs to appear might be lethargy. Other signs include weight gain, mood changes, inability to handle stress, and awakened immune system. She offers a natural healing approach to rebuild fatigued adrenals. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 345 - The Art of Emotional Alchemy
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Unwanted and negative emotions are like lead on our bodies. When we release and clear unwanted emotional baggage and patterns, we are able to live with a calm clarity. The triggers that caused negative responses from the collective, our cultural, childhood programming and beliefs no longer have such a strong effect on us. For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Rowena McKee. She will explain about the Art of Emotional Alchemy that is an inner healing process that uses Meridian Psychotherapy, Energy Psychology, EFT and Mind Body Medicine Techniques to release resistant emotions. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 342 - Terrorists in Love: The Real Lives of Islamic Radicals
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Political" talks, listen to an interview with Ken Ballen. He offers the first inside account of why radical Islamists join Jihad. Drawing on unprecedented access, Ballen profiled six terrorists to offer an astonishing new portrait of our enemies as we have never senn them. You'll learn about the secret war councils of Mullah Omar and the Taliban leadership; how the Pakistani Intelligence Agency - the ISI - funds, arms and protects the Taliban leadership and its insurgents to fight against the U.S. in bordering Afghanistan; what goes on behind the closed doors of the royal family of Saudi Arabia - the country that provides most of the funding for Al Qaeda; and more. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 339 - Voyage of Purpose: From Near Death to Back to Life
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In celebration of Halloween and for Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with David Bennett. He is an ordinary guy from a hardscrabble background and became a tough talking naval engineer. One day, he DIED. He'll talk about his experience of dying and his almighty fight against stage 4 Lund, Bone and Spinal Cancer. You'll learn about Bennett's visitation by beings of light, his life review and the vision he was given into his future from "the other side." Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 338 - The New Job Security
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Employment" talks, listen to an interview with Pam Lassiter. She'll explain that the new job security of today is not dependent on expecting a company to support you until retirement. Job security is alive and well and centered in you, not a company. She offers five best strategies for achieving work security and success to help you uncover interesting alternative jobs; generate multiple income streams; shape your job so that it reflects your values and goals; move successfully within your company; and plan for career transitions so that they're under your control. Interview by Daniel Davis and college intern, Devin DeCuna. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 337 - Preparing for Your Own Death
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with Roshi Jan Chozen Bays, MD from Oregon. She'll explain that most of our fear arises from fear of death. And, an essential part of spiritual practice is to face the fact of our inevitable death and to prepare for it. To do this can be a gift to our family and friends. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 336 - The End of Growth: Adapting to Our New Economy
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Green Living" talks, listen an interview with Richard Heinberg. He proposes a startling diagnosis: peak oil, peak water, peak food can lead to the end of growth, and also the beginning of a new era of progress without growth. It is a time to build a new economy that operates within Earth budget of energy and resources, while reinventing money and commerce. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 334 - The Liberated Baby Boomer: Making Space for Life
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Kater Leatherman. She will take you on an eclectic journey through clutter and beyond. To affect change in our live, we must first empty out what no longer serves us. It's a process of dealing with the fear, layers of clutter and staying rid of material clutter. By creating space to live your life, you'll feel more happy, joyous and free! Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Education" talks, listen to an interview with Ricki Linksman. item.title: EPISODE 328 - Why College is the Worst Investment Parents Can Make!
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Steve Olsher. According to him, parents are better off playing the Lotto than paying for your 18-year-old to go to college if you want to realize a decent return on your investment. Your child will not only have the responsibility of a high student loan to pay back, but there's also the great possibility of not pursuing the career or landing a job within their chosen major/area of focus after graduation. Olsher offers good alternatives that can benefit the parents and their child. Hosted by Beyond 50's intern, Devin DeCuna. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 327 - 5 Steps to Take a Good Marriage to Great
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Marriage" talks, listen to an interview with Terri Orbuch, Ph.D. Known as "The Love Doctor," she has followed hundreds of married couples to identify what keeps happily married couples thriving and what factors tear them apart. She offers a 5-step plan to create significant, postive changes in your relationship - instantly. They are 1. Expect less and get more. 2. Give and you shall receive. 3. Practice the "10 Minute Rule." 4. Flip the sheets! and 5. Keep costs low and benefits high. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 325 - Effective Immediately: How to Shine in the Workplace
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Bright-eyed college graduates think they are ready to take over the world, but lacking the skills necessary to shine in the workplace, they are left taking over administrative tasks instead. To more up, you must get noticed. To more up you must get noticed. To get noticed, you must be distinctive. To be distinctive, you must be known for results. For Beyond 50's "Business" talks, listen to an interview with Emily Bennington. She will offer help for new employees master the basics of business and elevate to the top of their game with the skills they need in order to be perceived as top performers. Co-hosted by Daniel Davis and intern, Devin DeCuna. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 324 - Generation Earn
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description:
For Beyond 50's "Personal Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Kimberly Palmer. If you are a parent with a young adult earning a living, this discussion is for the both of you. Today's young professionals have taken on more debt than previous generations, but they are not slackers living off of credit cards as many believe. Palmer will discuss about the 3 phases of life that relate to finance: 1. Building Your Life (topics include "The Joy of Spending" and "The Upside of Debt"), 2. Creating a Home (like "Lessons in Modern Frugality" and "When Parents are Landlords (or Renters)"), and 3. Changing the World (such as "Nonprofit Dreamin'). You'll especially want to learn about stock investing that's specifically for the 20-somethings.
*Interview co-hosted by Daniel Davis and intern, Devin DeCuna. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 322 - The Power of Your Past: Recalling, Reclaiming and Recasting
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: There's nothing wrong with "living in the now" - except that it's only part of our story. For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with John P. Schuster. He'll expose the many ways we ignore, distort, or become captive to our pasts and will explain how we can tap into this underutilized treasure trove. The negative experiences of our past must be recast - reinterpreted so that they no longer lessen our possibilities, but rather serve to expand our understanding of who we are and what we can be. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 321 - Filmmaker on Shaman, Don Jose Campos & The Ayahuasco Plant
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with filmmaker on Michael Wiese on his experiences with Peruvian shaman Don Jose Campos of Pucallpa, Peru. Internationally respected, Campos introduced to Wiese the practice and benefits of Ayahuasca, the psychoactive plant brew that, according to the latest finds, has been used for healing by Amazonian shamans for as long a 70,000 years. Ayahuasca is called a plant teacher because it can heal physical, psychological and emotional blocks. Through vivid visions, Ayahuasca takes the patient to other realms and dimensions, providing profound insights into human beings' true nature and place in the cosmos. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

It's to show how innovators and entrepreneurs can discover and profit from business and technology trends. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 318 - The Cheapskate Next Door
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Jeff Yeager. He traveled the country, interviewing hundreds of families to find out their secrets of living happily below their means. Many of them revel in the fact that they have a minimum amount of debt and seem to love not being plugged into extreme consumerism. You'll also learn strategies on spending less and saving more than the average American. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 317 - Bright Light: Spiritual Lessons from a Life in Acting
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with longtime actress, Dee Wallace. She is famous for her roles in "E.T.," "The Howling," and "Cujo." She'll talk about her how the actor's craft became a spiritual journey for her and how she applied those lessons to her life. It is also a story of Everyman: how we lose our light and steps we can take to reclaim it. Like her co-star E.T., the journey home comes from following the heart's lead. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 316 - Generations, Inc.
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Career" talks, listen to an interview with Meagan and Larry Johnson, a father-daughter team. Learn from them about how to manage the confluence of Woodstock Nation and the Facebook Generation - and everything in between. They offer powerful solutions to problems of intergenerational conflict in the workplace, especially when professionals of different ages have different definitions of concepts like success, work ethic, priorities, and a job well done. They don't always see eye to eye. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 315 - Financial Recovery
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Financial" talks, listen to an interview with Karen McCall. She'll help you to wake up from the money coma. You can live within your means and in a meaningful way. Unknowingly, people commit the same money crimes over and over. Learn about how to unveil these destructive habits and find practical solutions that work for you. The true answer to financial freedom is to be free of obsession and worry, while remaining clear and conscious about how to deal with your money. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 314 - The Bond: Connecting Through the Space Between Us
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For centuries, Western science and Western culture have taught us to think of ourselves as individuals. But today, a revolutionary new understanding is emerging: What matters is not he isolated entity, but the space between things, the relationship of things. The Bond. For Beyond 50's "Science & Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with Lynne McTaggart. She will explain that the essential impulse of all life is a will to connect rather than a drive to compete. In fact, we are inescapably connected, hardwired to each other at our most elemental level. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Business" talks, listen to an interview with Pat Sigmon. She can help you figure out why your business is no longer earning what it once earned or maybe even why your employees are making more money than you. It's time to stop making payroll and get past the roadblocks that are holding your business back from the success it deserves. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 312 - Living Fully, Dying Consciously
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Carolyn North. She has helped four of her terminally ill friends prepare for death by living fully, up to their last moments as they declined physically and emerged spiritually. Learn how to accept your own mortality and in the process, discover what it means to love. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Human love plus Nature equals Conscious Gardening. For Beyond 50's "Gardening" talks, listen to an interview with Michael J. Roads. He'll talk about going back to his roots - revisiting the organic garden. He'll show you that by being far more aware and conscious in our moment by moment of working in the garden, we can make a connection with Nature that transcends our previous experience and knowledge. item.title: EPISODE 310 - The Genie in Your Genes: Epigenetics & Biology of Intention
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: A brand new branch of science promises a revolution in health and happiness. It is called Epigenetics - control of genes from outside the cell. We used to think that our DNA determined much of our behavior, as well as our physical characteristics. No more. For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Dawsen Church. He offers exciting, scientific research to show that many genes are being turned on and off - every day - by your beliefs, feelings, and attitudes. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: A new era of sharing-based businesses is beginning. For Beyond 50's "Business" talks, listen to an interview with Lisa Gansky about how the "buy less, use more" trend is already driving new businesses and reinventing old ones in an enormous range of industries. Successful Mesh companies include Zipcar, Kickstarter, and Groupon. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 308 - Meet Shri Babaji & Experience His Supreme Peace
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description:
For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview hosted by Laurie Day from Oregon. She will talk with the world-renowned Shri Babaji - a Self-Realized Yogi who is established in the Supreme Peace. His full name is Shri Shiva Rudra Balayogi Maharaj. He Loves Everyone! He is Love, Compassion and Humility. He carries on the Mission of His Divine Guru, Shri Shivabalayogi. Here, Babaji is interviewed by Laurie Day, holistic psychotherapist. Laurie will be asking such questions as: What happens to the soul when the body dies? What is real Love? How do we keep our Hearts open? Is it good to pray? How do we pray effectively? What is Karma? What are the signs that let us know we are making spiritual progress? Will You speak about the Wonder of the Infinite? To learn more, visit www.shivarudrabalayogi.org
*We also encourage you to also visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 307 - 5,000 Years of Korean Martial Arts
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "History" talks, listen to an interview with Barry Harmon. He'll explain about Korea's most extensively lost history, which is traditional martial arts. Because of rigid new-Confucian ideas of the last several hundred years, the attempted annihilation of Korean culture in the 20th century, the martial arts heritage of Korea has been widely overlooked, forgotten and misunderstood even by her own people. Harmon will explain about Korean martial arts' place in history in proper perspective in relationship to Chinese and Japanese martial arts history. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 306 - Game Frame: Games as Strategy for Success
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Aaron Dignan. His goal is to end boredom for all. He offers a realistic picture of how the future could look should we choose to adopt game mechanics in our everyday lives. Contrary to popular belief, he argues, games produce peak learning conditions and accelerated achivement. After all, as we are psychologically hard-wired to achieve our best wihin game playing, it is to our advantage to turn life's challenges into a series of games to reach our peak potential. Find out about the root cause of burn-out in entry level jobs across any industry and the changes needed to engage millions in the burned-out workforce. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com

Her book features her Nature's Healing System, a 28-day program that has helped thousands of her students overcome weight issues, skin problems, fibromyalgia, insulin dependence, insomnia, sinusitis, and countless other health problems. item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Parenting" talks, listen to an interview with Susan Shapiro Barash. Find out why the expectations for mother-daughter connections are greater than ever before. She offers an eye-opening study of mothers and daughters of all ages. You'll learn why it is that whether a daughter is three or thirty, mothers second guess their mothering abilities. Why there is such tension in the best mother/daughter relationships and why you avoid confrontations with your daughter at any cost. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 302 - Failure to Launch: Kids Out Now!
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Parenting" talks, listen to an interview with Ellen Gibran-Hesse. She will show you how to get your teens and young adults to independence. Most kids are aware that they'll have to be independent and responsible someday, but they're unaware of when "someday" is or what will be required when "someday" arrives. Don't send your kids out into the world unprepared. Give them life skills and set yourself free! Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 299 - The Buteyko Method: A Natural Cure for Asthma
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Thomas Yakovlev - Fredericksen. He is the co-founder of Buteyko Center USA, teaching a simple breathing exercise that has been used in Russia for more than five decades. It is now gaining traction in the U.S. Many asthma sufferers have been overcome with gratitude after using the Buteyko Mthod to get immediate relief from coughing, stuffy nose, shortness of breath, and panic from not being able to breathe. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 298 - Fit Soul/Fit Body
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Brant Secunda and Mark Allen. They will help you to have a powerful connection between your physical body and the inner, intangible part of you called the "soul" - that allows you to do just about anything. Get into the best shape of your life. Secunda is a shaman, healer, and ceremonial leader in the Huichol Indian tradition of Mexico. He completed a twelve-year apprenticeship with Don Jose Matsuwa, the renowned Huichol Shman who lived to be 110 years old and who adopted Brant as his grandson. Mark Allen is a six-time Ironman Triathlon Champion. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.
item.itunes:author: Daniel Davis
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE 298 - Fit Soul/Fit Body
item.itunes:summary: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Brant Secunda and Mark Allen. They will help you to have a powerful connection between your physical body and the inner, intangible part of you called the "soul" - that allows you to do just about anything. Get into the best shape of your life. Secunda is a shaman, healer, and ceremonial leader in the Huichol Indian tradition of Mexico. He completed a twelve-year apprenticeship with Don Jose Matsuwa, the renowned Huichol Shman who lived to be 110 years old and who adopted Brant as his grandson. Mark Allen is a six-time Ironman Triathlon Champion. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 297 - Taming Your Outer Child
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Susan Anderson. She is a nationally renowned expert on abandonment recovery. She's back on our program to explain about the Outer Child - the source of our acting out and our bad habits and of our habitual, problemantic behaviors, not the devil. According to her, imagine the Inner Child as being five years old, the sourc eof our emotional needs. Anderson suggests that the Outer Child is more like 10 - 13 years old, the source of inappropriate acting-out behavior. Your Outer Child is the embodiment of your defense mechanisms. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 296 - Camilla Lackberg: Sweden's #1 Bestselling Author
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: If you are a fan of Stieg Larsson (who wrote "The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest") and seeking more Nordic crime fiction, then you'll like Camilla Lackberg. For Beyond 50's "Literary" talks, listen to an interview with Sweden's most profitable, native author in Swedish history who has sold more than 7 million copies worldwide and is the 7th bestselling novelist in Europe, ahead of both Henning Mankel and John Grisham. She'll talk about her crime novel, "The Ice Princess" that is making its American debut. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 295 - The Source of All Things: A Memoir
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Tracy Ross. She will share her riveting story of her childhood, her relationship with her stepfather and a mistake that has taken 30 years and thousands of miles of raw wilderness to reconcile. Statistically, 1 in 4 girls and 1 in 6 boys have been sexually abused by the time they are eighteen. But unlike most survivors, Ross found the courage and strength to speak out about her experiences and eventually confront her abuser. From skiing in the woods of northern Michigan to trekking across the glaciers of Alaska to guiding teenagers through the deserts of Southern Utah, Tracy pushed herself to the physical limit on her way to becoming whole again. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

Ayurveda means "knowledge of life" that is a holistic system of over 5,000 years old. The ultimate mind-body coordination is to be so in touch with one's body that disease becomes an impossibility. item.title: EPISODE 292 - Berried in Chocolate
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Business" talks, listen to an interview with Shari Fitzpatrick. She will explain about how she built a multi-million dollar business doing what she love and how you can too. With no business education or experience, Fitzpatrick only had a $1,500 cash advance and a passion for chocolate-dipped strawberries when she started a home0based business 20 years ago. Today, a second successful venture, the Berry Factory, is the provider of the nation's leading brand of gourmet berries. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 290 - Robert Cheeke: Vegan Body Building
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Fitness" talks, listen to an interview with Robert Cheeke, a nationally renowned vegan body builder. He has taken two seemingly contradictory lifestyles, vegan and body building, to demonstrate that you can build your body as an athlete on a 100% plant-based diet. He offers many reasons to go vegan, as well as his experiences with diet, training and contest preparation. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 289 - Cracking the Hidden Job Market
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Can't find a job? Maybe you're seeing only half the picture. For Beyond 50's "Employment" talks, listen to an interview with Don Asher. He will show you how to find jobs before the posting hits the Internet. His suggestions are about finding opportunities in any economy. Many Boomers today are out of work, fearing being out of work, or having their kids in the basement because they are out of work. The interview is co-hosted by Beyond 50's Daniel Davis and our college intern, Devin DeCuna (representing Generation Y/Millenials). Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 288 - Herbalist, Susun Weed: Herbs for Menopause & Andropause
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Susun Weed. We've brought her back to explain about specific herbs and their combinations that can help with hormonal imbalances in women with Menopause and men with Andropause. She is internationally renowned for teaching what she describes as the "Wise Woman Way" of herbalism. Her teachings encompass herbal medicine, ethnobotany, pharmacognosy, psychology of healing, eco-herbalism, nutrition and women's health issues.

item.title: EPISODE 285 - Is Slow Money the Answer to the Global Economic Crisis?
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Could there be an alternative to the stock exchange, dedicated to slow, small and local? Could a million American families get their food from Community Supported Agriculture (CSA)? What if you had to invest 50 percent of your assets within 50 miles of where you live? For Beyond 50's "Sustainability" talks, listen to an interview with Woody Tasch. He will present an essential, new strategy for investing in local food systems and introduces a group of fiduciary activists who are exploring what should come after industrial finance and industrial agriculture. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 284 - Hire on a Whim: The 4 Qualities That Make for Great Employees
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Job candidates wrongly believe that job experience is what employers value most. Not so! For Beyond 50's "Employment" talks, listen to an interview with Garrett Miller. He'll explain that there are four traits employers look for in an exceptional job candidate: outstanding work ethic, even in the face of stressors and personal challenges; integrity to do what's right, especially when forces are telling you to do the opposite; maturity, which enables you to be stable, wise and resilient in times of turmoil; and humility, or the willingness to learn, listen and serve without complaint. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Steve Olsher. He'll explain how many of us tend to lose touch with our inner greatness as we get older. He'll talk about getting a clear understanding of your life's purpose - and about getting fired up to achieve it. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 276 - The Revolutionary Trauma Release Process
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with David Berceli, an international expert in the areas of trauma intervention and conflict. He'll explain about how the body freezes and the resulting physical tension prevents the emotional tension from being released, which maintains the negative thoughts. You'll learn how to easily access and release the tension by evoking body tremors for relief from mild to severe traumatic experiences. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com

Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Imagine moving from the limitations of operating primarily from your head - where every thought, action and decision is unconsciously dictated by past conditioning - to reconnecting with your heart and the wellspring of wisdom that resides within, so you can experience the exquisite liberation of living a heart-centered life. For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Russell Feingold. He will explain about how to reconnect with your heart and its inherent wisdom to feel, think and respond differently to every experience that unfolds in your life. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 271 - Start with No: 11 Negotiation Strategies for Your Business
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Is compromise hurting your business? Chronic compromising, also known as getting to yes may be the single most harmful behavior pattern a small business owner can fall into. For Beyond 50's "Business" talks, listen to an interview with Jim Camp, a nationally renowned business negotiator. He'll discuss about 11 negotiation strategies that can get suppliers and contractors to give you a lower price; woo prospective customers by inviting them to decline your offer; and more. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 270 - Resiliency in the Workplace
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Managers and employees are often overwhelmed by the amount of change being imposed on them by internal and external forces. Generally, they won't openly discuss it because it threatens their sense of job security, and as a result, the dilemma gets suppressed, then symptoms emerge like blame, criticism, scapegoating, above normal conflict, lost work days, lower productivity, lack of engagement, and higher turnover become the norm. This is an enormous cost to you and a continuous drain on resources. For Beyond 50's â??Businessâ?? talks, listen to an interview with Executive Coach, Ed Ferrigan. He will talk about neural science and how the brain works to provide the essential insights to addressing this ongoing issue at a root level. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 269 - The Law of Forgiveness
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Connie Domino. She is known by many as "The Forgiveness Lady." Learn about this universal law that can be enacted and invoked to manifest your goals and dreams. Follow along with her to recite three forgiveness affirmations: to forgive others, others to forgive you, and for you to forgive yourself. Many who have tried it reported great success. To practice forgiveness is to unlock the power to attract what you really want - and receive myriad blessings in every part of your life. Her method does not require that you confront the offending party. It can be done in the privacy of your own home. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with Bradford Keeney, PhD. item.title: EPISODE 258 - Call of the Camino, A Pilgrimage
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Travel" talks, listen to an interview with Robert Mullen. He will talk about his pilgrimage on the Camino Frances path to Santiago de Compostela in the westernmost point of Spain. You'll learn about the myths, legends and miraculous stories that have, over time, become attached to this most popular of pilgrimages. Many who have heeded the "call of the Camino" have left behind what is familiar and habitual in order to wake each day to a new vista. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for the free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 257 - The Final Edition
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Fictional Book" talks, listen to an interview with Lawrence Meyer, a 32-year "Washington Post" reporter and blogger for "The Huffington Post." He'll talk about his new novel, "The Final Edition" that depicts a family-owned newspaper, but contains real history about the newspaper business, from FDR to JFK. Lawrence will discuss about the state of newspapers today, from the recent Wikileaks controversy and moral obligations in journalism, down to how newspapers hold a community together. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 256 - Le Deal: How an American Built a European Enterprise
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Business" talks, listen to a Byrne Murphy about his personal story of starting off as a young American in business, in love, and in over his head, kick-started a multi-billion dollar industry in Europe. He demonstrated how difficult it can be for an American to succeed in Europe, but how it can be accomplished. Byrne moved to Paris with his wife and baby daughter to start the company, McArthur Glen Europe, which grew from nothing to $1 billion in sales from 11 designer outlet centers across Europe that offer name brand fashions at 60% off. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 255 - Hoodwinked: Why the World Markets Imploded
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Economics" talks, listen to an interview with John Perkins, a former Economic Hit Man. He pulls back the curtain on the real cause of the current global financial meltdown to show how we've been hoodwinked by the CEOs who run the corporatocracy - those few corporations that control the vast amounts of capital, land and resources around the globe - and the politicians they manipulate. He also offers a way out to create a healthy economy. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 254 - How to Make Peace in the Middle East in 6 Months of Less
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Political" talks, we'll have Gregory Levy back on the show again. He was a former English speech writer for Prime Ministers Ariel Sharon and Ehud Olmert. He'll talk about his quixotic quest for making peace in the Middle East himself. Drawing on his broad base of contacts, from former White House officials and former spies to armchair generals and Jewish grandmothers - Levey attempts to find out why the Middle East problem refuses to be resolved - and also why so many people who live a world away from the Middle East are so eager to try their hand at policymaking. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 253 - 3-D Map of the Universe: A Grand & Bold Thing
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Science" talks, listen to an interview with Ann Finkbeiner. She'll talk about a massive undertaking by hundreds of astronomers to survey the sky, called the Sloan Digital Sky Survey. In spite of their culture, personal inclinations, and best professional interests - created a 3-D map of the sky that was complete, detailed and huge; a grand and bold thing. Through this viewpoint, they've been able to watch galaxies forming and merging with other galaxies; seeing streams of stars swirling out from galaxies; and understanding how the bright smooth universe of the Big Bang evolved into the one we know. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 252 - The Astronomical Significance of 2012
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Science" talks, listen to an interview with Robert McGown, renowned physicist and astronomer. He will discuss about the astronomical significance of 2012 as related to the Mayans, constellations, and the transit of Venus. Venus was an important planet to the Mayan culture, as well as many other cultures around the world. Robert will be leading a Venus transit expedition and will discuss this exciting event which will not happen for another 122 years. It's an event you won't want to miss. Tune in to Beyond 50 Radio and sign up for our free e-newsletter at www.Beyond50Radio.com

item.title: EPISODE 243 - The Journey of Italians in America
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Italians have influenced American life since the beginning of the Republic. Thomas Jefferson adapted the classic Italian architecture of Andra Palladio in designing his home and the University of Virginia; discussed agronomy and political philosophy with his neighbor, the Italian-trained physician and merchant Philip Mazzei; signed the Declaration of Independence along with William Paca of Maryland; and invited Italian musicians to form the first marine band in Washington, D.C. For Beyond 50's "History" talks, listen to an interview with Vincenza Scarpaci. She'll talk about the millions of Italians who have immigrated to the United States, bringing with them a distinct set of beliefs, traditions, and customs, which have been preserved and passed down through generations. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 240 - ZRT Lab:Adrenals & Adrenal Fatigue
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Are you tired for no reason? Having trouble getting up in the morning? Need coffee, colas, salty or sweet snacks to keep you going? Feeling run down and stressed? These are classic symptoms of adrenal burnout. For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Jim Paoletti of ZRT Laboratory about this condition. He will explain about the classic symptoms of adrenal burnout, testing for it, causes, and his recommended lifestyle changes. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 239 - Koss Brothers: The Earth's Best Story
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainable Practices" talks, listen to an interview with Arnie Koss. He will talk about his bittersweet tale of sparking an organic revolution through the baby food company, Earth's Best, that was founded with his twin brother. It's a recount of their transition from eking out livings as sprout growers and broom makers to being the first organic food to sit beside mainstream competitors on the nation's supermarket shelves. Their story is personal, intense and inspirational! Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 238 - ZRT Lab: Stress Hormones & Heart Disease
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's â??Natural Healingâ?? talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Sanjay Kapur of ZRT Lab. He will explain about stress leading to getting fat and heart disease. Unfortunately, this is a fact. Emotional and physical stress can lead to chronically high cortisol levels, which have a huge impact on overall health. Cortisol, also know as the stress hormone, is central to many biochemical processes and is not supposed to remain high for long periods. How you all respond to stress and chronically high levels of hormone cortisol affects the appetite, body weight and overall health and wellness. Dr. Kapur's discussion will provide answers to questions about how to reduce stress and avoid getting heart disease. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our weekly e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 234 - The 10 Things to Do When Your Life Falls Apart
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Daphne Rose Kingma. She is regarded by many as the "Einstein of Emotions." She will explain about how to come to terms with the larger truth of our lives when we're experiencing tough times. She will explain about her ten simple, yet profoundly effective strategies for addressing despair on practical, emotional, and spiritual levels. item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com

item.title: EPISODE 227 - Holistic Brain Neurotherapy: Successful Case Studies
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Adrienne Nicoll, RN, BSN. She will talk about retraining the brain naturally for optimal functioning with Holistic Brain Neurotherapy. Learn about its effectiveness on a variety of medical conditions like ADD/ADHD, post-traumatic stress, depression, anxiety, addictive behaviors, sleeping difficulties, anger, lack of energy, poor memory, stress, chronic pain, lack of focus, compulsive behaviors, eating disorders, brain injury and more. Just like your heart, your brain works best when it keeps the right rhythms. It is time to see what a balanced brain can do for you! Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 225 - Monkeys are Made of Chocolate
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In celebration of Earth Day, listen to an interview with Jack Ewing, a naturalist and conservationist. He'll share fascinating stories about living in Southwestern Costa Rica at Hacienda Baru - reforesting the whole area, which was later declared a wildlife preserve. item.title: EPISODE 224 - Wild Chickens & Petty Tyrants
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Arnie Kozak, a psychologist who has studied with the Dalai Lama. He'll talk about original metaphors and creating your own, drawn from Buddhism to clarify mindfulness and encourage us to practice it even amid internal or external chaos. Wild chickens are a metaphor for people in our lives who are "loud" and not to let them compromise our calmness or interfere with our ability to practic mindfulness. Petty tyrants are persons who are consistently grumpy and dismissive of us, no matter what we do. They are a reminder to catch ourselves before mindlessly reacting and to not take ourselves too seriously. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 222 - The Three-Legged Stool: Tax-Efficient Retirement Planning
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Finance" talks, listen to Rick Rodgers, one the country's top wealth managers. He'll explain about the IRS looking forward to your retirement. Due to our complicated tax system, the government is entitled to a significant amount of your retirement assets - unless you protect them properly. You'll learn about his Three-Legged Stool approach, involving Leg One: Tax-Deferred Savings Strategies; Leg Two: After-Tax Strategies; and Leg Three: Tax Free Savings Strategies. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 220 - Where the Heart Was
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "History" talks, listen to an interview with Glenn G. Boyer, a "Great American Novelist" and world authority on Wyatt Earp of the Wild West. He'll talk about the heartland of his Midwestern boyhood that was strange and fascinating, like heirlooms in a forgotten trunk. His fictional story traces the history of America's Republic, from the Revolution through the Civil War, to the Great Depression, and told through the eyes of his book's character, Bennie Todd. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 206 - Parenting Teens with Love & Logic
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Parenting" talks, listen to an interview with Jim Fay, founder of the Love & Logic Institute. He'll give some easy-to-do techniques that are an alternative way to communicate with kids and young adults that places a heavy emphasis on respect towards them. As an example, one of the most effective ways for your kids to stop with the blame game and not wanting to be held accountable for their actions is to give them lots of empathy before delivering the consequences. Fay's methods make nagging, yelling, threatening, and warnings unnecessary. The turnarounds in their behavior can be amazingly quick! Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 203 - Depression is Contagious!
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Michael Yapko, Ph.D., a world renowned clinical psychologist. Depression is the world's most common mood disorder and is spreading like a viral contagion. Learn from Yapko about a new course of treatment for depression. It's not a medical illness but a social problem, he argues, that will continue to spread until we address the underlying causes and quite probably the most important ingredient for the cure - other people. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 197 - Wachan, an Incan Medicine Man
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Through an ongoing collaboration between Beyond 50 and Ringing Rocks Foundation, listen to a "Cultural Diversity" talk with Wachan, an Inca Medicine Man. He was born and raised in the high mountains of Cuzco, Peru and comes from a long lineage of medicine people. In early childhood, Wachan was introduced to the healing arts by his father, Don Bonifacio (Hunta Chullu), a "Hamautta": high Inca priest who is the keeper of the wisdom and knowledge. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 196 - Angels of the 21st Century
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks for the holidays, listen to an interview with world renowned clairvoyant, Sonja Grace about her new book, "Angels of the 21st Century". You'll get a clear understanding of the death process, because it is in dying that we come to know living. Sonja connects the everyday with the astral, the mundane with the eternal. It's a refreshing and accessible read for the person who has lived enough life to want to know some answers for the difficult questions, Do we reincarnate individually or in families? How do we clear past karmic hangovers? Why is my life appearing to be unfulfilled? Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.description: Nothing is as crucial to landing the perfect job as a stellar performance in the job interview, where every answer can make or break an opportunity. item.itunes:author: Daniel Davis
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE 188 - 101 Toughest Interview Questions
item.itunes:summary: Nothing is as crucial to landing the perfect job as a stellar performance in the job interview, where every answer can make or break an opportunity. For Beyond 50's "Meaningful Work" talks, learn from Frances Bolles Haynes about the latest techniques and proven strategies to win the job. She'll go over some of the toughest and most commonly asked interview questions, along with sure-hire answers interviewers want to hear. Instead of "canned" responses, she suggests answers that get to the heart of an employer's concerns. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.
item.itunes:keywords: Baby Boomers, Mid-Life, Educational, Entertaining, Feature Experts and Celebrities, Solution-Oriented, Visionary, MId-Life Transitions, Mid-Life, Mature Lifestyle

item.title: EPISODE 187 - The Secret History of World War II: Pearl Harbor & Germany
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In recognition of Veterans Day, listen to Beyond 50's "History" talks with Mark Weber of the Institute for Historical Review. He will reveal little known history behind World War II. There's plenty of evidence that the Pearl Harbor attack by the Japanese, called "The Day of Infamy," was known in advance by President Roosevelt, and the U.S. government even provoked the enemy into doing it. It's deceit at the highest level! You'll also learn about other surprising truths involving Germany.

item.title: EPISODE 184 - Winter: Growing a Giant & Organic Garden
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Gardening" talks, listen to an interview with Roland Evans. He is part of a long line of family gardeners from Ireland, going back to the 1890s. His brother John is famous for earning 9 Guiness Book of World Records for growing the largest vegetables. According to him, the secret is in the soil. He will talk about how to prepare your Winter plantings for growing them organic and extra big through revitalizing the soil using a compost tea of lots of micro-organisms. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 183 - Inflammation is the Root Cause of the Biggest Killers
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Duke Johnson of Nutrilite. He will introduce the new field of nutrigenomics: the science of how nutrients interact with our DNA molecules and affect how our genes are expressed. He has debunked the idea that your family genes necessariy determine your fate. He'll also discuss why inflammation, not genetic heritage, is the main risk factor for the "big four" chronic diseases. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainable Practices" talks, listen to an interview with Carolyn Roberts. She yearned to live in harmony with nature with her two teenage sons in the Southwest and decided to build her own dream home made of straw. With no carpentry experience, it was a labor of love and pains - rebuilding herself along the way. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 178 - The Road to Woodstock
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "History" talks, listen to an interview with Michael Lang, the promoter of the Woodstock Music & Art Fair held in upstate New York (in photo above). You'll learn about Lang's maneuvering and deal-making that resulted in a concert attended by 500,000 people on August 15, 1969. He was only in his 20's at the time. He deemed himself part of a new generation rejecting the old social order and embracing fresh ideas about such issues as civil rights, sexuality and drugs. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 174 - Reinventing Collapse: The Soviet Example & American Prospects
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Sustainable Practices" talks, listen to an interview with Dmitry Orlov, the author of "Reinventing Collapse." He will explain that the current collapse in America is very similar to what the people of the Soviet Union went through in the 1980s. For the Soviets, the real cause of their country's breakdown was from the petroleum industry crashing. Learn about how they have had to tap into other natural resources. What is going on in America can be seen as an opportunity. By staying optimistic in a post-oil end game, we can survive and thrive during these challenges. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Jim Paoletti of ZRT Lab. As a talk for menopausal women and andropausal men, he will talk the importance of balancing your hormone levels through Bioidentical Hormone Replacement Therapy (BHRT). You'll find out the basics on the different types of BHRT therapies and a way to measure your hormone levels from home using a kit that requires a sample of your spit and spot of blood. item.title: EPISODE 170 - Eco-Wisdom from an Ecuadorian Shaman
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Through a collaboration with the Ringing Rocks Foundation, Beyond 50 is committed to preserving indigenous cultures, healing practices and wisdom for all to learn from. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 164 - Noah benShea: The Journey to Greatness & How to Get There
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Noah benShea, an internationally renowned poet-philosopher. His inspirational quotes have appeared on 30 million Starbuck coffee cups and 70 million C&H sugar packets. He'll explain about adversity as the breeding ground for history's greatest leaders. Our surroundings and possessions don't dictate greatness. Our actions are at the helm. You'll gain lots of insight about your personal journey toward greatness. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 163 - Summer: Growing an Organic & Giant Garden/Friendly Haven Farm
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Gardening" talks, listen to an interview with Roland Evans. He is part of a long line of family gardeners from Ireland, going back to the 1890s. His brother John is famous for earning 9 Guiness Book of World Records for growing the largest vegetables. According to him, the secret is in the soil. He will talk about how to prepare your summer plantings for growing them organic and extra big through revitalizing the soil using a compost tea of lots of micro-organisms. Afterwards, listen to Jacqueline Freeman of Friendly Haven in Washington about enjoying the natural rhythms and cycles on her biodynamic farm full of animals in the summertime. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 161 - Dr. Bernie Siegel: Faith, Hope & Healing
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with internationally renowned author Dr. Bernie Siegel of "Love, Medicine and Miracles". He'll talk about his new book, "Faith, Hope & Healing" that is about courageous men and women who have not only been cured of cancer, but have also found deeper faith, hope, joy and healing by coming to terms with their own mortality. It can help you to develop a survivor's attitude and personality traits. You'll find that strategies useful in getting through difficult times and discovering the gifts - true gifts - that illness can bring into your life. item.title: EPISODE 157 - Somatic Psychology for Self-Healing
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Ed Ferrigan on Somatic Psychology - a form of body-centered psychology that uses the body and its movement to understand and transform human behavior. The idea is that "the issues are in the tissues." Our history resides in our muscles, bones, tissues and cells. Most forms of psychology focus on the area above the neck. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 154 - Rocket Men: An Epic Story of the First Men on the Moon
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In celebration of the annual anniversary of the Apollo 11 moon landing that occurred on July 20, 1969, we will interview Craig Nelson, the author of the epic story called "Rocket Men." It's a fascinating book that's full of real-life drama. You'll learn about the ex-Nazi scientists who find themselves on the streets of Huntsville, AL; pigs suffocating rocket test flights; getting the American flag to stand upright in the hard surface; and more. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks listen to an interview with Cheryl Rounds about using natural bodycare that's non-toxic. item.title: EPISODE 149 - Sundays in America
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Travel" talks, listen to an interview with Susan Strempek Shea. Out of curiosity, she decided to take a year-long pilgrimage across the United States (covering 30 states) to explore the meaning of faith among worshipers on Sundays. It was an exhilarating road trip. Susan participated in a sing-along service at a Cowboy Church (like the one in the photo above), attended mass at an airport chapel, prayed at Barack Obama's church, met with President Jimmy Carter, and more colorful experiences. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 148 - "Chasing Waves" Around the World
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Hobbies" talks, listen to an interview with avid surf boarder Amy Waeschle. She'll talk about her evolution from nervous newbie to self-confident and skillful surfer, and shares her globe-trotting adventures to catch the next big wave in Fiji, Costa Rica, Chile, Mexico and other locales. And in the course of her surfing odyssey, Waeschle learns to balance love and family with her overwhelming surf lust. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Big companies like Wal-Mart, Dell, Fidelity Investments and more have been swindling American communities. item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Business Basics" talks, listen to an interview with Gail Larsen, the founder of Real Speaking. She'll prove that anyone can deliver a powerful and inspiring message if they go deep enough to find what is theres (and only theirs) to say. This is not about technique, presentation development, and overcoming fear. She'll unveil myths of what makes a great speaker and teach anyone who wants to change the world about how to access their own true voice to speak effectively and change minds. item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Raphael Cushnir on how to let go of our resistance to feeling the hard emotions. item.title: EPISODE 141 - Adventurist Helen Thayer on Living with Wolves
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Travel" talks, listen to an interview with Helen Thayer from Washington. She is regarded by National Geographic as "One of the Great Explorers of the 20th Century." We've had her on the program before to talk about walking her husband the whole length of the Mongolian Gobi Desert (about 1,500 miles) in her 60s. She'll discuss about about hiking with her husband Bill above the Arctic Circle in the Canadian Yukon Territory to live for six months, one hundred feet from a wolf den to observe and form a friendship with the wolves in the wild. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 140 - Springtime at Friendly Haven Farm
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Sustainable & Eco-Friendly Practices," listen to an interview with Jacqueline Freeman, the co-owner of the Friendly Haven Rise Farm in Venersborg,WA. She'll talk about biodynamic farming in the Springtime. Their methods are based on the principles of Rudolph Steiner, an Austrian social philosopher of the twentieth century. Steiner understood the Earth to be a living, interconnected organism; the farm should be a self-contained organism that functions like a microcosm. Steiner is also known for the idea of Community Supported Agriculture (CSA), Waldorf schools, and anthroposophical medicine. Visit www.Beyodn50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 136 - How to Prosper in the Coming Bad Years (Part 3 of 3)
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: The devaluation of the American dollar with the subsequent inflation, is eerily similar to the chaotic markets of the 1970s. The factors that created the stagflation and the gold and silver bull markets of the late 70s and 80s are back. Only this time, they're ever more exaggerated. For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, we've brought back Howard Ruff, a nationally renowned financial advisor and author of "How to Prosper in the Coming Bad Years of the 21st Century". He'll explain about America becoming a socialist country and how to prosper through investments during a deep, economic recession and depression. This is part 3 of 3 interviews with Howard Ruff. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 135 - The Grief Recovery Handbook
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Death & Dying" talks, listen to an interview with co-author John W. James of The Grief Recovery Institute. You'll learn about ways to recover from all kinds of loss: death, retirement, divorce, empty nest, moving, and more. They will also explain that the 5 Stages of Grief outlined by Elisabeth Kubler-Ross is more of a myth from their experiences in working with many clients. Their handbook can guide you on the journey of self-healing. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 134 - One with the Herd: Living with Semi-Wild Horses
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Pet Care" talks, listen to an interview with Liz Mitten Ryan. She is a world-renowned artist and Horse Whisperer. Her book, "One with the Herd" is about a true love story with amazing quotes from her semi-wild herd of horses for many to learn from their wisdom. Ryan explains why she gave up a successful art publishing business in the city to live on a huge acreage with the herd. Many from around the world visit her ranch for self-healing. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 133 - Brian Peskin: The 24-Hour Diet
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to bestselling author Brian Peskin. He'll explain that everything you've learned about nutrition is all wrong! He busts the most common nutritional myths and corrects them with the latest research findings. He is the world's most trusted authority on health and nutrition. Through his book, "The 24-Hour Diet," you'll learn about the most ideal way to eat well and the science behind it that's never been revealed before to the general public. Peskin is also the author of "The Hidden Story of Cancer" about oxygen deficiency on a cellular level as the primary cause of cancer. Too many medical researchers and doctors look at and treat the secondary causes: toxins, virus, and more. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 131 - Spring Time: Growing an Organic & Giant Garden
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Gardening" talks, listen to an interview with Roland Evans. He is part of a long line of family gardeners from Ireland, going back to the 1890s. His brother John is famous for earning 9 Guiness Book of World Records for growing the largest vegetables. According to him, the secret is in the soil. He will talk about how to prepare your springtime plantings for growing them organic and extra big through revitalizing the soil using a compost tea of lots of micro-organisms. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.
