item.title: EPISODE 129 - Little Grandma Selina of the Wabanaki People
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Cultural Diversity" talks, listen to an interview with Little Grandma Selina, a Medicine Bundle Keeper of the Wabanaki People from Nova Scotia. She is of blended spirit of mixed ancestral heritage (Mi'kmaq/Black). Grandma Selina follows the path of the ancient Sacred Pipe that is over 500 years old. With this Sacred Medicine comes the Wisdom Teachings of the Ancient Ones that she carries in her heart. This talk is made possible through a collaboration between Beyond 50 and the Ringing Rocks Foundation to preserve the traditions of indigenous shamans, healers and medicine keepers worldwide. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 126 - Harry S. Dent: The Great Depression Ahead
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, listen to Harry S. Dent. He is a renowned economic forecaster with an uncanny success at predicting economic trends over the last 30 years. He recognizes that our economy goes through 39 - 40 year peak cycles: 1929, 1968, and now somewhere in 2008 - 2009. These are mostly by generational (population) peaks in spending. The Baby Boomer spending peak is coming to an end! Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 125 - 90-Second Fitness Solution (Part 2)
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Fitness" talks, listen to an interview with Pete Cerqua, an amazing trainer! His brilliant 15-minute-per-week workout promises to beat cardio at shedding pounds and reduce bodies by a half-dress size without changing food choices. It even accelerates the metabolism. His simple exercises, which only require resolve, a wall and a floor, are done in 90-second repetitions using pauses and holding weights in key positions, rather than slow movements. He busts myths about working out, up and down the fitness spectrum. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

The factors that created the stagflation and the gold and silver bull markets of the late 70s and 80s are back. Only this time, they're ever more exaggerated. For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, we've brought back Howard Ruff, a nationally renowned financial advisor and author of "How to Prosper in the Coming Bad Years of the 21st Century" about the reality of being in an economic crisis for years, even with the financial programs proposed by President Obama. He'll also explain about how to prosper through investments during a deep recession. This is part 2 of 3 interviews with Howard Ruff. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 118 - The Great American Heart Hoax
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with renowned pioneer in preventative cardiology Dr. Michael Ozner. He will explain that heart surgery may not be necessary. Many heart treatment don't work. Nine major studies in the U.S. and Europe have found that bypass surgery neither prolongs life nor prevents heart attacks in 70 - 90% of patients. Additionally, angioplasties and stents can actually increase the likelihood of future attacks. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 102 - The 90-Second Fitness Solution (Part 1)
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Fitness" talks, listen to an interview with Pete Cerqua, an amazing trainer! His brilliant 15-minute-per-week workout promises to beat cardio at shedding pounds and reduce bodies by a half-dress size without changing food choices. It even accelerates the metabolism. His simple exercises, which only require resolve, a wall and a floor, are done in 90-second repetitions using pauses and holding weights in key positions, rather than slow movements. He busts myths about working out, up and down the fitness spectrum. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Professor Brian Peskin about advancing the studies of Dr. Warburg. item.itunes:author: Daniel Davis
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE 100 - The Hidden Story of Cancer: There is a Cure!
item.itunes:summary: It's been known since 1920 that the prime cause of cancer was determined by Nobel Prize Winner in Medicine Dr. Otto Warburg. It has to do with cellular oxygen. He wrote about it in a research articled called "The Metabolism of Tumours" in Germany. For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Professor Brian Peskin about advancing the studies of Dr. Warburg. He has taught many how to stop cancer in its growth, even if it's at an advanced stage. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 99 - Rich Brother, Rich Sister: Family Lessons on True Wealth
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with international bestselling author and entrepreneur Robert Kiyosaki and his younger sister Eni. Eni is a highly devout Buddhist nun, ordained by the Holiness the Dalai Lama. The book came about as their two worlds collided when cancer and heart disease threatened Eni's health and a bad insurance plan gave way to a situation which a Buddhist monk suddenly had to think about economics. Brother and sister became reacquainted and discovered each other's philosophy. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 98 - Join the Free Energy Movement!
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: If you're familiar with alternative energy forms (like solar, wind, geothermal), there is another kind called free energy. The inventors who harness this power create amazing technologies like a car run by a water fuel cell, a battery charger powered by the earth, or a home furnace driven by permanent magnets - most are little known by the public. The most famous of these inventors is Nikola Tesla. For Beyond 50's "Emerging Trends" talks, listen to an interview with Joel Garbon, a leader in the "Free Energy Revolution" to support these unique inventions so they can be made available for use by the masses. He'll also discuss about his book called "Breakthrough Power: How Quantum Leap New Energy Inventions Can Change the World." Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 97 - Reduce Your CardioMetabolic Risk After 50
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: The latest medical findings point to the importance of two new diagnostic tests: Hemoglobin A1c and C-Reactive Protein - in addition to traditional risk markers in determining overall cardiometabolic risk. These important tests provide vital information to help monitor average glucose levels and inflammation in the body to further determine cardiometabolic risk. For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Sanjay Kapur, Scientific Director with ZRT Lab about your heart health and a comprehensive blood spot test you can take at home called the CardioMetabolic Profile 1. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 96 - New Year Predictions for 2009
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Emerging Trends" talks, listen to Elizabeth Peter of Red Lotus. She is an expert on Eastern and Western Astrology to give her annual predictions. She's been amazingly accurate for the last two years on-the-show, so we've brought her back to go over what's to come worldwide in 2009. Last January, she predicted America's financial collapse and breakdown of major industries, from the banking system to traditional media. The upside is that we can rebuild them to be more ethical and sustainable in how they operate for all. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 84 - Where Does the (Federal) Money Go?/How to Become Prosperous
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Scott Bittle and Jean Johnson about understanding the federal budget in a fun way. According to them, the two biggest financial strains on all is paying for Social Security and Medicare. Tax cuts (as the politicians promise) are not even going to make a dent on our multi-trillion dollar deficit. An event better policy is for the new administration to raise taxes. Afterwards, Joan Sotkin is back again to talk about our emotional dysfunctions around money and how to really create a foundation for prosperity during hard economic times. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 83 - Poison Pills: The Untold Story of the Vioxx Drug Scandal
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Buyer Beware! Watch out for pharmaceutical companies that heavily market their drugs and offer free samples. That was the case with Vioxx that released their drug for chronic pain and arthritis without extensive testing, resulting in an increased risk of heart-related disease and deaths nationwide by users of it. Listen to Beyond 50's interview with Tom Nesi of "Poison Pills" about the Vioxx profiteering scandal and the dark history of the pharmaceutical industry. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Over the years and with economies collapsing, there's been a cry by politicians (from all sides) and the general public to end the Federal Reserve System (also called the Fed). If you'd like a wake-up call on what the protest is all about, then listen to Beyond 50's "Economics" talk by G. Edward Griffin, author of "The Creature from Jekyll Island" who will reveal how the Fed has manipulated America's economy to be in wars, determine our boom-bust cycles, "financially murder" the middle class, and other evils. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 79 - How to Grow Giant Vegetables/Dress Your Middle Age
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Hobbies" talks, listen to an interview with Roland Evans of Bountea. He is the brother of John Evans who holds several world records for growing the largest vegetables. Roland will explain how it's done using a compost tea with lots of microorganisms and other tricks. He also specializes in growing highly organic fruits and vegetables and will share some of his own gardening secrets. Afterwards, Jandi Gerard of Inspire Style offers great tips and strategies for Boomer men and women to look good as the body ages over time. item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Within 3 - 5 years of graduating from college, a large percentage of young adults return back to the "nest". For Beyond 50's "Parenting" talks, listen to an interview with Ellen Gibran-Hesse, the author of "Failure to Launch" about how to really prepare your kids, arming them with practical skills so that they can live independently on their own and not have to return. item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, we're having Joan Sotkin back again. She's the bestselling author of "Build Your Money Muscles" to talk about how to deal with fears around money, especially in reaction to the recent financial crisis. She'll also discuss about emotional dysfunctions around money that can keep many wanting to overspend, underearn and stay chronically in debt. Afterwards, listen to an interview Leigh Ann Jasheway-Bryant, the Accidental Comic who is a stress management and humor expert, writer, and comedy coach. She'll discuss about how Boomers can help themselves to be happy as you go through your many life transitions that can be uncomfortable, even traumatic. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Richard Bitner, a former founder of a subprime mortgage company that went from a tiny operation to a booming business. He'll give a behind-the-scenes idea about the players who created the subprime disaster; their fraudulent practices; how they turned unqualified applicants to "qualified borrowers"; and why Wall Street and the rating agencies are largely to blame for the collapse. item.title: EPISODE 68 - Ho'oponopono from Hawaii/Understanding Hypnotherapy
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: When bestselling author Joe Vitale heard stories about a remarkable Hawaiian doctor who healed a ward of mentally ill criminals completely without ever meeting them in person using Ho'oponopono, he was intrigued and wrote about it in "Zero Limits." Tune in to hear from Dr. Ihaleakala Hew Len, the actual healer about how to use this method for yourself that teaches "total responsibility" for everything that is in your life, "cleaning" the negativity, and to reconnect with the Divine. Afterwards, Matthew Brownstein, the Executive Director of the Florida Institute of Hynotherapy will explain about effectively treating conditions (about 30 - 50%) that are psychosomatic (originating from the mind) using hypnotherapy. Our memories are stored in the subconscious mind, and have within them beliefs, which cause our emotions, which can manifest as symptoms in our bodies. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 63 - Mexico's Ancient Toltec Wisdom/Listening for Coyote
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In recognition of Hispanic Heritage Month (Sept. 15 - Oct. 15), Beyond 50 encourages you to listen to an interview with Miguel Ruiz Jr. He is the son of don Miguel Ruiz, a nagual (shaman) of the ancient Toltec traditions in Mexico to guide people towards personal freedom. His father is a world renowned healer who wrote "The Four Agreements." You'll learn about their dream teachings, unique practices, and some history. Afterwards, William Sullivan from Oregon will discuss about his 1,361-mile solo backpacking trek, from Oregon's westernmost shore of Cape Blanco to Oregon's easternmost point in Hells Canyon. It took him an adventuresome 2 months. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 61 - Taking the Axis of Evil World Tour
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "World Travel" talks, find out from Scott Fisher what it's like to be the first American to visit all three axis of evil countries: Iran , Iraq and North Korea . According to him, getting in is very, very difficult. It took many months to get approved. Once inside, his passport and local currency were taken away from him. He shares many great stories of his travels. As a side note, President George Bush this year declared that North Korea is no longer an "evil country". Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 56 - A Soldier's Heart/Heart of Your Illness
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen Dr. Edward Tick, a psychotherapist and director of a nonprofit called a Soldier's Heart. He will address the needs of many veterans who are wounded souls wanting to be whole again. Dr. Tick is a pioneer in the work of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), or "loss of the soul" as he calls it. He will share his innovative methods that have helped many veterans nationwide. Afterwards, if you are facing a serious illness, Linda Resca, a two-time cancer survivor, will teach you how to keep fear from being the guiding force of your decisions. She takes individuals on their personal, deep journey of healing to align with truth from the heart and how to consciously listen to its whisperings. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

Afterwards, if you are facing a serious illness, Linda Resca, a two-time cancer survivor, will teach you how to keep fear from being the guiding force of your decisions. She takes individuals on their personal, deep journey of healing to align with truth from the heart and how to consciously listen to its whisperings. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 52 - A Year Without Shopping/Ten Biggest Divorce Mistakes by Women
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: If you think you're frugal, then listen to Beyond 50's interview with Judith Levine who spent a whole year without shopping, but just for necessities. You'll hear how she had to discipline herself in an extreme way and resolve within herself a lot of ingrained attitudes about materialism and over-spending that's socially encouraged. Dare yourself to try this. Afterwards, Grace Antares will go over what a divorce entails for women who are contemplating it. item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainable Practices" talks, listen to William Sullivan discuss about what it was like building a log cabin with his wife Janell in the wilds of Oregon's Coast range and living there every summer for over 25 years. He'll also bring up solving a murder mystery on the property with the help of a ghost. Afterwards, Thomas Hupp will talk about "The Farm" that was a social experiment about communal living by Hippies during the late 1960's that continues to be a model for creating modern-style, intentional and eco-village communities worldwide. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.description: Ahh, memories of summer camp...singing "If I Had a Hammer", getting to third base with your camp crush, learning archery, bunk room raids, and tie-dye making. item.title: EPISODE 36 - Hell or Highwater: Kayaking World's Largest Gorge in Tibet
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Imagine a gorge that is 3X deeper and 8X steeper than the Grand Canyon. Now imagine kayaking its treacherous waters. It's called the Tsangpo River Gorge in Eastern Tibet that is considered sacred to Buddhists and is the inspiration for James Hilton's "Shangri-La." Listen to Peter Heller who followed a whitewater expedition to kayak these waters and lived to tell about it. He'll also talk about his great experiences with the Tibetans of the area. Tune in to celebrate May as Asian American Heritage Month on Beyond 50. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE 9 - The Physics of Football & 2008 NFL Prediction/Year of the Rat
item.itunes:summary: Every year, we bring back two favorites: Timothy Gay, the best-selling author of "Football Physics: The Science of the Game" to educate about the sport and give his annual NFL prediction of what team will win the Super Bowl, offering a physics perspective. Afterwards is Elizabeth Peter, a specialist in Eastern and Western Astrology to reveal her best predictions of what's to come in 2008: The Year of the Rat. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 6 - The Year of Living Biblically
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: To kick off the New Year, listen to the hilarious interview with A.J. Jacobs, the Esquire editor (and human guinea pig) who literally spent an entire year following nearly 700+ wise (and some baffling) rules of the Bible, from the Ten Commandments down to stoning adulterers. By becoming an ultra-fundamentalist, he learned many lessons about not taking the Bible too literally in our modern times. Visit us at www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 4 - Walking the Entire Gobi at 63
item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Helen Thayer achieved her lifelong dream of walking 1,500 miles, from east to west, the length of the Mongolian Gobi Desert at 63-years old within 60 days. Accompanying her was her 74-year old husband and two camels, Tom and Jerry. Hear about the life threatening dangers along the way and the goodwill exchanges with the local Mongolians. This is for Beyond 50's talks on "World Travel." Visit us at www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our e-newsletter.

item.author: beyond50@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, Faith Bernard of Isagenix talks about the importance of nutritional cleansing that is done first before going on a weight loss program. And for our "Personal Growth" talks, we'll have George Schofield, Ph.D., the author of "After 50 It's Up to Us" talk about developing the skills and agility we'll need to deal with the many life transitions we will face as we age.
